mng: to tread, to stamp, to step on, to press a pedal, to investigate on the spot

exm.mng: lit. tread the green; go for a walk in the spring (when the grass has turned green), spring hike season around Qingming festival 清明, 4th-6th April
firmly based, steady, steadfast, to have peace of mind, free from anxiety, Taiwan pr. [ta4 shi2]
to have one's feet firmly planted on the ground (idiom); realistic without flights of fancy, steady and serious character
stride, to step (on the spot), to mark time, at a standstill
pedal (in a car, on a piano etc), treadle, footstool, footrest, footboard
to set foot in, to tread (in or on), to walk into
to set foot on, to step on or into
